titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Center For Student Life Records RG.12.16
titlestmt.author: Kate Fisher

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-11-30 10:39:24 -0500.

change.item: Updated to include materials integrated from accession number 2019.010 by Samantha Rowe.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York University. Center for Student Life

physdesc.extent: in 2 record cartons, 4 manuscript boxes, 1 flat-box, 1 half manuscript box, 8 serials boxes, 1 oversize flat box, and 1 flat-box file-folder.

did.abstract: The Center for Student Life Records contains paper and electronic records of student publications; fliers; event posters and calendars; photographs; brochures; guides for campus programs for incoming students; and programs from the Center for Student Life created for the students from 1958-2018. The materials of the collection respond to the history of student social life at New York University, which include student-led organizations, lecture series, as well as sororities and fraternities. The Center for Student Life engages New York University students to foster a sense of community and support students' transition into campus life.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from New York University Archives. Please contact university-archives@nyu.edu.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by David Vogelsang, Executive Director, Center for Student Life in May, 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.016. An additional accretion of materials was donated by David Vogelsang, Executive Director, Center for Student Life in September 2018. The accession number associated with the accretion is 2019.010.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Center for Student Life engages New York University students during their transition into campus life. The Center serves as a central point of information and campus-wide events, and helps students navigate various aspects of the university, including clubs, fraternities, sororities, class activities boards, and community service opportunities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Center for Student Life Records contains paper and electronic records of student publications; fliers; event posters and calendars; photographs; brochures; guides for campus programs for incoming students; and programs from the Center for Student Life created for the students from 1958-2018. The materials of the collection respond to the history of student social life at New York University, which include student-led organizations, lecture series, as well as sororities and fraternities. The program guides document President's Service Award ceremonies, parent activities, and student orientation from 1989 to 2018. Additionally, the collection consists of original student artwork from certain members of these organizations. There are signed performance posters by reputable artists, such as musicians Sufjan Stevens and Joan Jett in addition to the comedian Mike Birbiglia.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Center for Student Life Records; RG 12.16; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were placed in new acid-free folders and boxes, and described on the collection-level.

At the time of accessioning, materials from accession 2019.010 were placed in acid-free boxes. A portion of the collection's content were foldered, while other printed materials remain unfoldered, but are housed in appropriately sized acid-free containers. Original caption information, when available, was transcribed onto acid-free archival folders. The archivist maintained the original order of the Box Content List, but certain materials were consolidated and include a Materials Separation Sheet that recorded these transfers.

Electronic records on CD-R format have been identified, inventoried, and physically removed from their original boxes but have not yet been imaged or analyzed. New York University Libraries follows professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity of the content.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: This collection was created and stored in the Center for Student Life. Various administrators and employees in the office collected the items. The majority of the items were collected and backed by Bob Butler, former director of the center for student life, but others may have also contributed to the collection as well.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact university-archives@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
